info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 10:51AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...WINTRY MIX WILL LEAD TO INCREASINGLY HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON... WEATHER... * A wintry mix of primarily sleet and freezing rain will continue across areas along and south of the I-94 corridor through the remainder of the morning. Periods of moderate intensity sleet and freezing rain will be possible over the next two hours, along with pockets of snow mixing in at times. * A trace to a tenth or two of snow and sleet accumulation, primarily on grassy surfaces will be possible through 1 PM. A glaze of ice will be possible on untreated roadways, bridges, exit ramps, overpasses, and other untreated surfaces. Up to 0.02 inch of ice accretion will be possible mainly on elevated surfaces. * Northeast winds will occasionally gust up to 25 mph. * Air temperatures will hover around 32 degrees. IMPACTS... * Light icing may lead to slippery roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for variable driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra time. Expect increasingly hazardous travel conditions as the day progresses. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
